text: Florence Junior/Senior High School, formerly Florence High School, is a public high school in unincorporated Fremont County, Colorado, United States, near Florence."Home." Florence High School. Retrieved on May 29, 2015. "2006 Highway 67, Florence, CO 81226" It is part of the Fremont RE-2 School District. ==History== In May 2015, Robert Basevitz, a former teacher, filed a lawsuit against Principal Schipper, superintendent of the school district Rhonda Vendetti, and the school district itself, accusing them of promoting Christianity in the school. Schipper said that the accusations were not true.Haythorn, Russell and Alan Gathright. "Teacher's lawsuit says public Florence High School is promoting Christianity to students." ABC 7 Denver. May 26, 2015. Retrieved on May 29, 2015. Florence High school merged with the district's middle school, Fremont Middle School, beginning in the 2019–2020 school year. The middle school was closed primarily due to concerns over the building's inaccessibility to the handicapped. The building of the school was purchased by Unbridled Holdings for $515,000. ==References== ==External links== * Category:High schools in Colorado Category:Education in Fremont County, Colorado
title: Florence Junior/Senior High School
